metadataTools 0.1.0

EcoForest_naming

EcoForest_naming.Rd

Naming conventions for EcoForest to be used in the metadataTools package.

Usage

EcoForest_naming

Format

A tibble with 8 rows and 5 columns:

name

Variable name (e.g., "Site_ID", "Plot_ID")

mandatory

Logical indicating whether the variable is required

valid_values

List of allowed values for each variable, or NULL if unrestricted

default_description

Text description of the variable's meaning and format

comment

Optional comments in addition to the description

Details

This dataset defines the naming conventions for data used in the EcoForest project. It includes metadata for standard EcoForest variables, such as whether they are mandatory, which values are valid, and default descriptions. It is intended to be used with functions like validate_naming_convention(), which checks that mandatory variables are included, that they only contain valid values, and attaches descriptions for the standard variables.

Examples

# Flextable of naming convention
view_naming_convention(EcoForest_naming)
#> Error in naming_object %>% dplyr::mutate(valid_values = sapply(valid_values,     format_valid), mandatory = ifelse(mandatory, "Yes", "No")) %>%     flextable::flextable() %>% flextable::fontsize(size = 8,     part = "all") %>% flextable::autofit(): could not find function "%>%"


# Create a dataset that matches the naming convention
df1 <- data.frame(
  Site_ID = rep(c("BLA", "BRA", "GUL", "HAL", "HEM", "LAN", "MRK", "OYT", "SAR", "SKO", "STR", "TRE"), each = 2),
  Forest_Type = rep(c("CC", "NN"), times = 12)
) %>%
  dplyr::mutate(Plot_ID = paste(Site_ID, Forest_Type, sep = "_"))
#> Error in data.frame(Site_ID = rep(c("BLA", "BRA", "GUL", "HAL", "HEM",     "LAN", "MRK", "OYT", "SAR", "SKO", "STR", "TRE"), each = 2),     Forest_Type = rep(c("CC", "NN"), times = 12)) %>% dplyr::mutate(Plot_ID = paste(Site_ID,     Forest_Type, sep = "_")): could not find function "%>%"

# Validate the dataset against the naming convention
validate_naming_convention(df1, EcoForest_naming)
#> Error: object 'df1' not found

# Example of how to create a naming convention tibble manually:
EcoForest_naming <- tibble(
  name = c("Site_ID", "Forest_Type", "Plot_ID", "Plot_Nr", "Sub_plot", "Sub_plot_FULL", "Year", "Date"),
  mandatory = c(TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE),
  valid_values = list(
    c("SKO", "GUL", "HEM", "BRA", "SAR", "OYT", "TRE", "HAL", "BLA", "STR", "MRK", "LAN"), #Valid values for Site_ID
    c("CC", "NN"), #Valid value for Forest_Type
    c("SKO_CC", "GUL_CC", "HEM_CC", "BRA_CC", "SAR_CC", "OYT_CC", "TRE_CC", "HAL_CC", "BLA_CC", "STR_CC", "MRK_CC", "LAN_CC", "SKO_NN","GUL_NN", "HEM_NN", "BRA_NN", "SAR_NN", "OYT_NN", "TRE_NN", "HAL_NN", "BLA_NN", "STR_NN", "MRK_NN", "LAN_NN"), #Valid values for Plot_ID
    NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL
  ),
  default_description = c(
    "Three-letter abbreviation of site names",
    "Forest Management Category (NN = near natural; CC = previous clearcut)",
    "Plot name composed of Site_ID and Forest_Type",
    "Number of each plot (e.g., Site_ID×Forest_Type; 1-24)",
    "Unique number of sub-plot (1-144)",
    "Combination of Plot_ID and Sub_plot (e.g., SKO_NN_1)",
    "Year in YYYY format",
    "Date in YYYY-MM-DD format"
  ),comment=rep("", 8)
)
#> Error in tibble(name = c("Site_ID", "Forest_Type", "Plot_ID", "Plot_Nr",     "Sub_plot", "Sub_plot_FULL", "Year", "Date"), mandatory = c(TRUE,     TRUE, TRUE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE), valid_values = list(c("SKO",     "GUL", "HEM", "BRA", "SAR", "OYT", "TRE", "HAL", "BLA", "STR",     "MRK", "LAN"), c("CC", "NN"), c("SKO_CC", "GUL_CC", "HEM_CC",     "BRA_CC", "SAR_CC", "OYT_CC", "TRE_CC", "HAL_CC", "BLA_CC",     "STR_CC", "MRK_CC", "LAN_CC", "SKO_NN", "GUL_NN", "HEM_NN",     "BRA_NN", "SAR_NN", "OYT_NN", "TRE_NN", "HAL_NN", "BLA_NN",     "STR_NN", "MRK_NN", "LAN_NN"), NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL),     default_description = c("Three-letter abbreviation of site names",         "Forest Management Category (NN = near natural; CC = previous clearcut)",         "Plot name composed of Site_ID and Forest_Type", "Number of each plot (e.g., Site_ID×Forest_Type; 1-24)",         "Unique number of sub-plot (1-144)", "Combination of Plot_ID and Sub_plot (e.g., SKO_NN_1)",         "Year in YYYY format", "Date in YYYY-MM-DD format"),     comment = rep("", 8)): could not find function "tibble"
